event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A non-fatal uncorrectable error associated with a core on a CPU chip has been detected.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
A non-fatal uncorrectable error associated with a core on a CPU chip has been detected.

The XSCF informs the domain software of the fault and the domain software will attempt
to offline the core, but could panic as a result of one of the following uncorrectable error traps:

   Uncorrectable error trap type 40 (TT=40)
   Uncorrectable error in a data field
   Domain may enter a RED state which may cause the domain to panic.

The core of the CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.


The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:04:36 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: a6eb18a7-a74c-4271-b47a-b4182ccad068
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8000-GR for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8000-GR, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:04:36 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: a6eb18a7-a74c-4271-b47a-b4182ccad068
   DESC: A non-fatal uncorrectable error associated with a core on a CPU chip has been detected.
   Refer to %FMAURL%/SCF-8000-GR for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The domain software will attempt to offline the core on the CPU chip.
   IMPACT: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic. If the domain
   does not panic, the domain software will attempt to offline the core on the CPU chip.
   The core of the CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
   after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command


   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u a6eb18a7-a74c-4271-b47a-b4182ccad068

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:04:36.7815 a6eb18a7-a74c-4271-b47a-b4182ccad068 SCF-8000-GR
           50%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.cpu.SPARC64-VI.core.se

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0/core=1
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0/core=1
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                            server-id=san-ff2-21-0:serial=PP06121471:
                            part=CA06761-D102 A0:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B/CPUM#0

           50%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.cpu.SPARC64-VI.core.se

                Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0/core=0
                   Affects: hc:///chassis=0/cmu=0/cpu=0/core=0
                       FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                            server-id=san-ff2-21-0:serial=PP06121471:
                            part=CA06761-D102 A0:revision=0101/component=/MBU_B/CPUM#0


Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: The non-fatal uncorrectable error trap may cause the domain to panic. If the domain does not panic, the domain software will attempt to offline the core on the CPU chip. The core of the CPU chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The domain software will attempt to offline the core on the CPU chip.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Non-fatal uncorrectable error detected within a core on a CPU chip.
